title: Relating to establishing the patriot family support fund and providing for tax exempt contributions made to such fund by an income tax return check off box
summary: Relates to establishing the patriot family support fund and enabling for tax exempt contributions to be made to such fund by providing for an income tax return check off box.
fulltext:
S T A T E   O F   N E W   Y O R K
       ________________________________________________________________________

                                         1197

                              2011-2012 Regular Sessions

                                 I N  A S S E M B L Y

                                      (PREFILED)

                                    January 5, 2011
                                      ___________

       Introduced  by  M.  of  A.  HAWLEY,  KOLB,  TOBACCO, McKEVITT, BUTLER --
         Multi-Sponsored by -- M. of A. CONTE,  MOLINARO,  WEISENBERG  --  read
         once and referred to the Committee on Ways and Means

       AN  ACT  to  amend the state finance law and the tax law, in relation to
         establishing the patriot family support  fund  and  providing  for  an
         income tax return check off box therefor

         THE  PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section 1. The state finance law is amended by adding a new section 81
    2  to read as follows:
    3    S 81. THE PATRIOT FAMILY SUPPORT FUND. 1. THERE IS HEREBY  ESTABLISHED
    4  IN THE JOINT CUSTODY OF THE COMMISSIONER OF TAXATION AND FINANCE AND THE
    5  COMPTROLLER,  A FUND TO BE KNOWN AS THE "PATRIOT FAMILY SUPPORT FUND" TO
    6  ASSIST FAMILIES DURING THE ABSENCE OF MILITARY SERVICE PERSONNEL.    FOR
    7  PURPOSES  OF  THIS SECTION A "MILITARY SERVICE PERSONNEL" SHALL MEAN ANY
    8  PERSON IN THE ACTIVE SERVICE IN THE ARMED SERVICES OF THE UNITED STATES,
    9  OR A MEMBER OF THE NEW YORK STATE MILITIA WHO IS ON ACTIVE DUTY, AND WHO
   10  IS:  DESIGNATED AS THE HEAD OF HIS OR HER HOUSEHOLD, THE SPOUSE  OF  THE
   11  PERSON APPLYING FOR FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE UNDER THIS SECTION, OR A PARENT
   12  OR LEGAL GUARDIAN OF A CHILD RESIDING WITHIN THIS STATE.
   13    2.  SUCH FUND SHALL CONSIST OF ALL REVENUES RECEIVED BY THE DEPARTMENT
   14  OF TAXATION AND FINANCE, PURSUANT  TO  THE  PROVISIONS  OF  SECTION  SIX
   15  HUNDRED THIRTY-C OF THE TAX LAW AND ALL OTHER MONEYS APPROPRIATED THERE-
   16  TO  FROM  ANY OTHER FUND OR SOURCE PURSUANT TO LAW. NOTHING CONTAINED IN
   17  THIS SECTION SHALL PREVENT THE STATE FROM  RECEIVING  GRANTS,  GIFTS  OR
   18  BEQUESTS  FOR  THE  PURPOSES  OF THE FUND AS DEFINED IN THIS SECTION AND
   19  DEPOSITING THEM INTO THE FUND ACCORDING TO LAW.
   20    3. ON OR BEFORE THE FIRST OF FEBRUARY OF EACH  YEAR,  THE  COMPTROLLER
   21  SHALL CERTIFY TO THE GOVERNOR, TEMPORARY PRESIDENT OF THE SENATE, SPEAK-
   22  ER  OF  THE ASSEMBLY, CHAIR OF THE SENATE FINANCE COMMITTEE AND CHAIR OF

        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.
                                                                  LBD01505-01-1

       A. 1197                             2

    1  THE ASSEMBLY WAYS AND MEANS COMMITTEE, THE AMOUNT OF MONEY DEPOSITED  IN
    2  THE  PATRIOT  FAMILY  SUPPORT FUND DURING THE PRECEDING CALENDAR YEAR AS
    3  THE RESULT OF REVENUE DERIVED PURSUANT TO SECTION SIX  HUNDRED  THIRTY-B
    4  OF THE TAX LAW.
    5    4.  MONEYS  IN  THE PATRIOT FAMILY SUPPORT FUND SHALL BE KEPT SEPARATE
    6  AND SHALL NOT BE COMMINGLED WITH ANY OTHER MONEYS IN THE CUSTODY OF  THE
    7  COMMISSIONER OF TAXATION AND FINANCE AND THE COMPTROLLER.
    8    5.  THE MONEYS IN SUCH FUND SHALL BE EXPENDED FOR THE REASONABLE NEEDS
    9  AND LIVING EXPENSES INCURRED BY MILITARY FAMILIES DURING THE  DEPLOYMENT
   10  OF MILITARY SERVICE PERSONNEL PURSUANT TO THIS SECTION.  APPLICATION FOR
   11  ASSISTANCE FROM THIS FUND MAY BE MADE ON FORMS DEVELOPED BY THE DIVISION
   12  OF  MILITARY  AND  NAVAL  AFFAIRS.  THE  DIVISION  OF MILITARY AND NAVAL
   13  AFFAIRS SHALL REVIEW APPLICATIONS FOR ASSISTANCE AND SHALL AWARD ASSIST-
   14  ANCE BASED UPON CRITERIA DEVELOPED BY THE DIVISION OF MILITARY AND NAVAL
   15  AFFAIRS AND AVAILABILITY OF FUNDS.  SUCH MONEYS MAY BE  APPLIED  TOWARDS
   16  EXPENSES  INCLUDING, BUT NOT BE LIMITED TO, CHILD CARE, HOME REPAIRS AND
   17  MAINTENANCE COSTS, MEDICAL EXPENSES, TRANSPORTATION EXPENSES AND  EDUCA-
   18  TION EXPENSES.
   19    6.  ALL  PAYMENTS  FROM  SUCH  FUND SHALL BE MADE BY THE DEPARTMENT OF
   20  TAXATION AND FINANCE AFTER AUDIT  AND  WARRANT  OF  THE  COMPTROLLER  ON
   21  VOUCHERS APPROVED BY THE DIVISION OF MILITARY AND NAVAL AFFAIRS.
   22    S  2.  The tax law is amended by adding a new section 630-c to read as
   23  follows:
   24    S 630-C. GIFT FOR PATRIOT FAMILY SUPPORT FUND. AN  INDIVIDUAL  IN  ANY
   25  TAXABLE  YEAR MAY ELECT TO CONTRIBUTE TO THE PATRIOT FAMILY SUPPORT FUND
   26  ESTABLISHED PURSUANT TO AND USED ONLY FOR THOSE PURPOSES  ENUMERATED  IN
   27  SECTION  EIGHTY-ONE OF THE STATE FINANCE LAW. SUCH CONTRIBUTION SHALL BE
   28  IN ANY WHOLE DOLLAR AMOUNT AND SHALL NOT REDUCE THE AMOUNT OF THE  STATE
   29  TAX OWED BY SUCH INDIVIDUAL. THE COMMISSIONER SHALL INCLUDE SPACE ON THE
   30  PERSONAL  INCOME  TAX  RETURN  FORM  TO  ENABLE  A TAXPAYER TO MAKE SUCH
   31  CONTRIBUTION. NOTWITHSTANDING ANY OTHER PROVISION OF LAW,  ALL  REVENUES
   32  COLLECTED  PURSUANT  TO  THIS  SECTION  SHALL BE CREDITED TO THE PATRIOT
   33  SUPPORT FAMILY FUND.
   34    S 3. This act shall take effect immediately and shall apply to taxable
   35  years beginning on and after January 1, 2013.
